intro: Siphocampylus candollei, commonly known as the candolle's siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in umbels, and it produces distinctive, elongated fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
